_header: When Sunday goeth by D and C
Note: For texts without the introduction, see 1215.
Bibliographic Ghosts:
Dublin, Trinity College, Dublin 516, f. 118: deleted by Robbins and Cutler (1965)
XRossell Hope Robbins, and John L. Cutler. Supplement to the Index of Middle English Verse. Lexington, Kentucky: University of Kentucky Press, 1965, confused with 6299.
_description: A political prophecy according to the throw of the dice, with an introduction of four lines — in couplets

CULIi611.First Lines:
When sonday gothe by d & cAnd þe prime by j &
                    ij…
CULIi611.Last Lines:
…The lyon þe Redroose & þe flower delyseThe Cock
                    schall vndoo and þe syse xall tell þe price
CULIi611.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James. 
             Ballads from Manuscripts.
         London: Ballad Society, 1863; repr. New York: AMS, 1968: 1.477.

BLCottRollsII23.First Lines: [     ]day goth by C D and E and p[     ]ly[     ] men shall so put S[      ]…
BLCottRollsII23.Note: 20 lines, on dorse; mostly illegible at endl.
